column9: Overall I have been satisfied with this drug, however I do have some of the side affects. I usually take the drug early in the morning. I have not had a problem since. These drugs can drop your blood pressure which will cause you to faint. Please read up on the side affects of these drugs. Taught me a lesson. The drugs still gives relief. I am considering the TUNA procedure. Read about it should fix the prostate problem.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: 37 Year Old Male.Was diagnosed with Acute Prostatis and given anti biotics as well as Rapaflo to help with urine flow + frequency and the misery/pain/senstation radiating thru my groin and surrounding area.Overall Rapaflo worked fairly well to reduce frequency and flow right away.  Within 1 day it provided relief.Overall it worked fairly well to reduce pain/burning/sensation but that took longer and may have been in conjunction with the anti-biotics.Stuffy nose as well, but that went away in a couple of days.Retrograde Ejaculation worst side effect.  Does not seem to go away as long as you take the drug.  Goes away in about 3 days after you stop taking it.  To compare - If you feel the standard male ejaculation is always a 9 or 10 (scale of 10), retrograde ejaculation is about a 2 on the pleasure scale.Terrible side effect but the relief is worth it for the short term.

column2: Scorpiokarma, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Rapaflo does work and works well. The BIG down side is the horrible side effects. My Doctor mentioned one side effect and none of the others. He gave me a few samples and an Rx. I started taking the pill and in 2 days I felt awful and here are some of the side effects I experienced: dizziness, lightheadedness, tightness of chest in breathing, being tired, doing a chore, I ran out of energy after about 5 minutes and had to sit down, a fog in my brain, disorietention, and a few others. I stopped taking the pill after 3 weeks and my body came back to normal in about 4 days. The Pharmacist warned me especially about the side effects and she was right on the money. Best advice if you HAVE to take it, take it at night before bed time not in the morning. This per the Pharmacist and it helped.
